name: TreeListy Help
description: Welcome to TreeListy! This help tree guides you through all features. Click any item to learn more.

items.name: What is TreeListy?
items.description:
TreeListy is a universal tool for breaking down any complex project, problem, or process into manageable parts.

Structure your work into phases, track dependencies between components, and analyze your entire plan at a glance.

Use it for:
‚Ä¢ Software projects
‚Ä¢ Sales pipelines
‚Ä¢ Academic writing
‚Ä¢ Product roadmaps
‚Ä¢ AI prompt design
‚Ä¢ Philosophy papers
‚Ä¢ Film production
‚Ä¢ Biographies (LifeTree)
‚Ä¢ And anything else that benefits from structured thinking!

items.name: Your First Tree
items.description:
1. Choose a Pattern from the dropdown (top of screen)
   - Generic Project for most uses
   - Philosophy for arguments and premises
   - Sales for pipelines and deals
   - LifeTree for biographies
   - 21 patterns total!

2. Add Phases (the main sections)
   - Click '+ Add Phase' button
   - Or use AI Wizard to auto-generate

3. Add Items to each phase
   - Right-click a phase ‚Üí Add Item
   - Fill in details in the edit modal

items.name: Import a Document
items.description:
To import text content into a tree:

1. Click 'üìÑ Analyze Text' in the toolbar
2. Paste your document content
3. Choose analysis mode:
   ‚Ä¢ Quick Mode - Fast, for straightforward docs
   ‚Ä¢ Deep Mode - Thorough, for complex analysis
4. Optionally enable 'Append to existing tree'
5. Click 'Analyze'

TreeListy uses semantic chunking to process large documents without hallucinating. It automatically segments by meaning, not just word count.

items.name: Add Dependencies
items.description:
Dependencies show which items must complete before others:

1. Click on any item to open it
2. Scroll to the 'Dependencies' section
3. Check the boxes for items that must complete first
4. Save changes

Dependencies appear as:
‚Ä¢ Arrows in Tree View
‚Ä¢ Lines connecting nodes in Canvas View
‚Ä¢ Predecessor links in Gantt View

items.name: Export to Excel
items.description:
To export your tree as an Excel workbook:

1. Click 'Save' dropdown in header
2. Select 'üìä Export Excel'
3. A multi-sheet workbook downloads with:
   ‚Ä¢ Summary sheet
   ‚Ä¢ One sheet per phase
   ‚Ä¢ All fields preserved

You can also import Excel files back into TreeListy using 'Open' ‚Üí 'Import Excel'.

items.name: Use Canvas View
items.description:
Canvas View shows your tree as a visual diagram:

1. Click 'Canvas' tab (or use view switcher)
2. Drag nodes to reposition
3. Use mouse wheel to zoom
4. Pan by dragging empty space

Canvas Controls:
‚Ä¢ 'Edges' button - Show/hide hyperedge connections
‚Ä¢ 'Layout' - Auto-arrange nodes (grid/radial)
‚Ä¢ 'Focus' - Center on selected node
‚Ä¢ 'Fit' - Zoom to fit all nodes

items.name: Create Hyperedges
items.description:
Hyperedges connect multiple related nodes (unlike dependencies which are 1-to-1):

1. Right-click on a node
2. Select 'Create Hyperedge'
3. Select additional nodes to include
4. Name the relationship

Hyperedges appear as colored hulls in Canvas View enclosing related nodes.

Use cases:
‚Ä¢ Group related items across phases
‚Ä¢ Mark items with shared themes
‚Ä¢ Create visual clusters

items.name: Use Gantt View
items.description:
Gantt View shows your project as a timeline:

1. Click 'Gantt' tab
2. Items display as bars based on dates/duration
3. Dependencies show as arrows between bars
4. Critical path is highlighted

Requires PM fields:
‚Ä¢ Start Date
‚Ä¢ Duration or End Date
‚Ä¢ Status (optional)

Use the Project Plan pattern for best Gantt experience.

items.name: API Keys
items.description:
To use AI features, you need API keys:

1. Click the AI provider dropdown
2. Select 'Configure API Keys'
3. Enter your keys:
   ‚Ä¢ Anthropic: console.anthropic.com
   ‚Ä¢ Google: makersuite.google.com
   ‚Ä¢ OpenAI: platform.openai.com

Keys are stored locally in your browser.
Never shared with TreeListy servers.

For hosted deployment, keys can be configured via environment variables.
